intro: Alchorneopsis trimera, commonly known as the slender flame tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and birds. The seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years, contributing to its ability to regenerate in suitable habitats.
